titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David T. Holland independent film collection 1994
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jimi Jones.

publicationstmt.publisher: Multimedia Archives, J. Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah

repository.corpname: University of Utah Libraries, Special Collections

did.unittitle: David T. Holland independent film collection
did.abstract: The David T. Holland independent film collection (1994) consists of two films made by Salt Lake City native David Holland while he was a student of film studies at the University of Utah. This collection is part of the Utah Independent Film Archive (UIFA).

scopecontent.p: The David T. Holland independent film collection (1994) consists of two films made by Salt Lake City native David Holland while he was a student of film studies at the University of Utah. This collection is part of the Utah Independent Film Archive (UIFA).

accessrestrict.p: Materials must be used on-site; no use of original material, access copies will be made available for viewing. Five business days advanced notice required. Access to parts of this collection may be restricted under provisions of state or federal law, condition of the material, or by donor.

did.unittitle: "The Crippled Quill" and an untitled narrative film

scopecontent.p: "The Crippled Quill" - Documentary. Filmmaker David T. Holland interviews members of "The Crippled Quill" about the organization's dedication to providing minority groups of the Salt Lake City area (such as the disabled and the homeless) a voice to the public through artistic means. Some of the film's subjects are veterans of foreign wars.

Unititled narrative - Unedited footage of a narrative about a man whose campfire is put out by a well-meaning bear in the forest. The bear then escorts the man to a designated camping area where they share the warmth of a fire.
